page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The{Belsay Estate}is the main landowner in our area. It was known to have belonged to the{Middleton}family as early as 1270. There are three main buildings on the Estate. 1.{The Castle.}This was constructed in the late 14th Century primarily as a defence against Border raiders. There are still traces of painted wall decorations dating back to the 15th Century to be seen in the{Great Hall. Although the castle now stands apart from the other buildings, during Medieaval times a village settlement grew up close by on what was then the main Jedburgh to Newcastle road. Belsay Village as we know it today did not come into existence until the 19th Century. 2.{The Manor House.}Now derelict, the house dates back to the early 1600's.
